filename.name: filename
filename.description: Filename relative to config directory on the home assistant server (e.g., 'statistics_inventory.tsv')

delimiter.name: delimiter

timezone_identifier.name: timezone_identifier

export_statistics.name: Export Statistics to file
export_statistics.description: Exports long term statistic values (1h) to a tsv/csv or a json file

filename.name: filename
filename.description: Filename relative to config directory on the home assistant server (e.g., 'exported.tsv' or 'myData.json')

entities.name: entities
entities.description: List of statistic IDs or entity IDs to export (supports both internal and external). Supports wildcard patterns using `*` (glob matching), e.g. `sensor.*_temperature` or `sensor.*temp*`. Leave empty to export all statistics. Constraints: `*` alone is not allowed; broad patterns like `sensor.*` / `sensor:*` must not be mixed with other entries. Make sure to use a Yaml list with `- `

start_time.name: start_time
start_time.description: The start time for statistics export in the format %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S (must be full hour, e.g. '2025-12-22 12:00:00'). If omitted, export starts from the earliest available statistic. Make sure to use quotes around the timestamp in Yaml.

end_time.name: end_time
end_time.description: The end time for statistics export in the format %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S (must be full hour, e.g. '2025-12-22 12:00:00'). If omitted, export ends at the most recent available statistic. Make sure to use quotes around the timestamp in Yaml.

split_by.name: split_by
split_by.description: Split output into multiple files by statistic type: 'none' (default, combined file), 'measurement' (only mean/min/max), 'counter' (only sum/state/delta), or 'both' (write both files). Output files will use suffixes _measurements and _counters before the extension.

timezone_identifier.name: timezone_identifier
timezone_identifier.description: Timezone identifier (check {pytz_url}). If not specified, uses Home Assistant's configured timezone

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.description: The delimiter between fields. Default is tab (\t). Options: tab, semicolon, comma, or pipe

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: The decimal separator character: dot ('.') or comma (','). Default is dot ('.').

datetime_format.name: datetime_format
datetime_format.description: The format of the datetime strings in the exported file. Default is '%d.%m.%Y %H:%M'. d .. day, m .. month, y .. Year, H .. hour, M .. minute
